content.description: In a study researching how donating to charity can affect a person’s happiness, <math alttext="96" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>96</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> participants were given <math alttext="$5" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>$</mtext><mn>5</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> a day for one week. Each participant was randomly assigned to one of two groups. Those assigned to the first group were asked to spend the money on themselves, and those assigned to the second group were asked to donate the money to charity. At the end of the week, all of the participants were asked to rate their overall level of happiness on a scale from <math alttext="0" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>0</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> to <math alttext="100" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>100</mn></mrow></mstyle></math>, with higher scores indicating greater levels of happiness.
content.question: Which of the following are the appropriate null and alternative hypotheses to test whether the sample data provide convincing statistical evidence that donating to charity results in greater happiness than spending on oneself, on average?

choices.label: <math alttext="H naught: mu sub self, minus mu sub charity, equals 0. H sub a: mu sub self, minus mu sub charity, is greater than 0." display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtable><mtr><mtd><msub><mrow><mtext>H</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>0</mn></mrow></msub><mo>:</mo><msub><mrow><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><mi>μ</mi></mrow><mrow><mtext>self</mtext></mrow></msub><mo>−</mo><msub><mrow><mi>μ</mi></mrow><mrow><mtext>charity</mtext></mrow></msub><mo>=</mo><mn>0</mn></mtd></mtr><mtr><mtd><msub><mrow><mtext>H</mtext></mrow><mrow><mtext>a</mtext></mrow></msub><mo>:</mo><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><msub><mrow><mi>μ</mi></mrow><mrow><mtext>self</mtext></mrow></msub><mo>−</mo><msub><mrow><mi>μ</mi></mrow><mrow><mtext>charity</mtext></mrow></msub><mo>></mo><mn>0</mn></mtd></mtr></mtable></mrow></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="H naught: mu sub self, minus mu sub charity, equals 0. H sub a: mu sub self, minus mu sub charity, is less than 0." display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtable><mtr><mtd><msub><mrow><mtext>H</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>0</mn></mrow></msub><mo>:</mo><msub><mrow><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><mi>μ</mi></mrow><mrow><mtext>self</mtext></mrow></msub><mo>−</mo><msub><mrow><mi>μ</mi></mrow><mrow><mtext>charity</mtext></mrow></msub><mo>=</mo><mn>0</mn></mtd></mtr><mtr><mtd><msub><mrow><mtext>H</mtext></mrow><mrow><mtext>a</mtext></mrow></msub><mo>:</mo><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><msub><mrow><mi>μ</mi></mrow><mrow><mtext>self</mtext></mrow></msub><mo>−</mo><msub><mrow><mi>μ</mi></mrow><mrow><mtext>charity</mtext></mrow></msub><mo><</mo><mn>0</mn></mtd></mtr></mtable></mrow></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="H naught: mu sub self, minus mu sub charity, equals 0. H sub a: mu sub self, minus mu sub charity, is not equal to 0." display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtable><mtr><mtd><msub><mrow><mtext>H</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>0</mn></mrow></msub><mo>:</mo><msub><mrow><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><mi>μ</mi></mrow><mrow><mtext>self</mtext></mrow></msub><mo>−</mo><msub><mrow><mi>μ</mi></mrow><mrow><mtext>charity</mtext></mrow></msub><mo>=</mo><mn>0</mn></mtd></mtr><mtr><mtd><msub><mrow><mtext>H</mtext></mrow><mrow><mtext>a</mtext></mrow></msub><mo>:</mo><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><msub><mrow><mi>μ</mi></mrow><mrow><mtext>self</mtext></mrow></msub><mo>−</mo><msub><mrow><mi>μ</mi></mrow><mrow><mtext>charity</mtext></mrow></msub><mo>≠</mo><mn>0</mn></mtd></mtr></mtable></mrow></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="H naught: mu sub self, minus mu sub charity, is less than 0. H sub a: mu sub self, minus mu sub charity, equals 0." display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtable><mtr><mtd><msub><mrow><mtext>H</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>0</mn></mrow></msub><mo>:</mo><msub><mrow><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><mi>μ</mi></mrow><mrow><mtext>self</mtext></mrow></msub><mo>−</mo><msub><mrow><mi>μ</mi></mrow><mrow><mtext>charity</mtext></mrow></msub><mo><</mo><mn>0</mn></mtd></mtr><mtr><mtd><msub><mrow><mtext>H</mtext></mrow><mrow><mtext>a</mtext></mrow></msub><mo>:</mo><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><msub><mrow><mi>μ</mi></mrow><mrow><mtext>self</mtext></mrow></msub><mo>−</mo><msub><mrow><mi>μ</mi></mrow><mrow><mtext>charity</mtext></mrow></msub><mo>=</mo><mn>0</mn></mtd></mtr></mtable></mrow></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="H naught: mu sub self, minus mu sub charity, is greater than 0. H sub a: mu sub self, minus mu sub charity, is less than 0." display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mtable><mtr><mtd><msub><mtext>H</mtext><mn>0</mn></msub><mo>:</mo><msub><mrow><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><mi>μ</mi></mrow><mtext>self</mtext></msub><mo>−</mo><msub><mi>μ</mi><mtext>charity</mtext></msub><mo>></mo><mn>0</mn></mtd></mtr><mtr><mtd><msub><mtext>H</mtext><mtext>a</mtext></msub><mo>:</mo><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><msub><mi>μ</mi><mtext>self</mtext></msub><mo>−</mo><msub><mi>μ</mi><mtext>charity</mtext></msub><mo><</mo><mn>0</mn></mtd></mtr></mtable></math>

topic.text: 7.8: Setting Up a Test for the Difference of Two Population Means

skill.text: Skill 1.F: Identify null and alternative hypotheses.
